title: Allegiant Air to Buy 50 Boeing 737 MAX Jets
sub_head: Agreement adds a U.S. customer for Boeing and provides an option for the carrier to buy 50 additional planes
body:
Low-cost carrier Allegiant Air is ordering up to 100 Boeing Co. 737 MAX jetliners, a win for the U.S. aerospace manufacturer that has suffered several setbacks in recent years.
Allegiant Travel Co. , the Las Vegas-based airlineâ€™s parent company, has placed an order for 50 aircraft with the option to buy 50 more. The deal includes 737-7 and 737-8-200 models.
